Reviews.Title: Good choice for the money
Reviews.Author: Slowfoot
Reviews.Content: Owning a SONY Bravia LCD and a Panasonic Viera plasma I knew I preferred the plasma and decided on this LG 50-inch for its hard to beat price. I considered it a secondary TV to my larger 1080p Panasonic so didn't mind this one's 720p resolution. After living with it for a few weeks, I'm happy with that decision and I would rate the picture very highly, with a couple minor reservations.  Some say you can't tell the difference between 720 and 1080, but I definitely can see the individual pixels when I'm within a few feet of the screen, and there is a slight difference on small, sharply edged images, like the ESPN screen crawl for example. If it's your habit to sit five or six feet from the TV you might want to spend extra for a 1080; but the farther you get from the screen the less difference between the two. At 10-12 feet this is an excellent picture, very close to my 1080 Panasonic.  The other niggle is that the screen is highly reflective, which can be annoying in brightly lit rooms. The picture itself is not to blame -- it is as bright and vibrant as my SONY Bravia.  There is a handy setup menu for adjusting the picture, Picture Wizard II, which will get you very close to ideal and there are plenty of adjustments to tinker with to get it how you like it from there.  I've read that LGs can't compete with Panasonics in black levels, but I don't notice a difference on my sets, and other than the subtle differences mentioned above, the two are extremely similar.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal for a Everyday TV.
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: The big scare anyone looking for a TV will have is the 720p. Won't your TV experience be ruined? The answer is maybe.First thing to consider is the TVs distance. If you are doing to be watching a TV of this size at lets say 8'or less 1080vs 720 would be noticeable. >8ft you probably couldn't tell unless you are some sort of TV guru.Second thing to consider is the content you intend to view the most. Except for your home blu-rays/game consoles or some Nexflix, your TV never gets a 1080p input. Your HD cable/dish is 480-720. Hulu is also 720p as is much of Netflix. All that being said, your intended use of the screen will determine if the 720 would affect you. All that being said, unless you intend to use the TV for a game room or a home theater, you probably are fine with 720 as most your content is less than 720.As far as this TV goes, like all plasmas the picture is great and you can't go wrong. The screen, for this price is also fairly thin. The bezel is also fairly small giving this TV a much more expensive look. I like this model because it is not a smart TV, which I advise avoiding. Smart TVs are nice, but a problem with the Smart feature is also a problem with the TV. If you instead use a Roku or similar device with your TV a problem with the Roku is isolated to the Roku.The only real negatives I have against this TV is the connections. I would like more side connections and more HDMIs. Overall this is a great buy though and don't pay extra for the 1080p that you probably don't need.

Reviews.Title: Awesome "Entry Level" Plasma Television
Reviews.Author: Richard Lowenthal "RichieLo"
Reviews.Content: First of all, for those people that are not familiar with LG and think it is an "off-brand", think again.  LG Electronics is a Korean company that began as two different companies: Lucky brand appliances and GoldStar electronics.  When the two companies merged, they became Lucky-Goldstar or LG.  LG is the second largest manufacturer of televisions in the world, second only to Samsung. Together, they dominate half of the world's display manufacturing. Screens manufactured by LG Display are used in monitors sold by Dell, NEC, ASUS, and even Apple for their Macs and iPhones.  To call the 42PA4500 an entry level plasma would be like calling the Nissan Maxima an entry level car.  Sure, compared to the Infiniti M-Class it is an entry level car but on its own it is more than adequate. It has all the bells and whistles that one would expect from a top-of-the-line television, such as variable picture and sound modes, a thin bezel, swivel stand, ambient light sensor, and pixel orbiter to prevent burn-in. There were no issues on arrival, such as defective pixels or loose connections.  The price, of course, was right.  At $497 all in for a 42 inch plasma there really is no going wrong.  Yes, the 720p resolution can be an issue for some.  But like they say, at this size you really can't tell the difference. I find that the difference, compared with the LG LCD in another room, is that standard definition channels look slightly fuzzier.  When watching HD there really is no difference. This is a 2012 model if I'm not mistaken, so many of the issues with plasmas have been resolved.  There is no screen door effect, and there is no real need for a break in period, although I am limiting my first 100 hours of viewing to HD channels without black bars and without little logos in the corners, set to a low contrast and brightness level. The screen is very reflective, however, so any lights will be visible on the screen. The downward facing 10-watt speakers sound best when the set is on a table rather than mounted on the wall, so the sound is reflected off the tabletop.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Christie A
Reviews.Content: This was my first flat screen tv. I have looked at them in stores for years, and knew the "quality" of the image I wanted. I totally took a chance because this one looked good, and the price was right.Delivery took about a week, but that was OK with me, they really made sure it was kept in perfect condition.It was really easy to set up... instructions are a little vague about putting the TV onto the stand you just assembled. So look at a picture on here if you can't get it on, the majority of the base needs to stick out the front of the tv.... a tad hard to line up, but we got it.At first the screen color was way to green, but the crispness and LARGE screen made it worth figuring out. Tried messing with tint, color, image, settings, ect. Nothing helped... but got a few settings that would be great for during a party!Anyway, turned out to be the XBox that we were playing a DVD through. When we took it off and finally got the DirecTV hooked up... WOW!!!!!!!!!Moved in a regular DVD player and it is awesome!!!! Time may tell another story, but for now, I'm like a kid at Christmas. I hear that there could be bad reflections on the screen, but in our room nothing hits it... any lights at night that interfer are just turned off for a great show.

Reviews.Title: Incredible TV!
Reviews.Author: PHIL SALLEY
Reviews.Content: I got this for a friend, but set it up at home side by side with my Samsung PN59d7000 which is of course 1080. If you set this TV up right, it is VERY close to the Samsung. Broadcast TV is at its best 720, so you get nothing from the 1080, Select the VIVID picture setting (which is sort of like a showroom setting for home use and adjust settings to your preference. This creates a very bright and sharp picture and since it is Plasma, no problem with motion. Why anyone would pay more for a high end LCD/LED TV is beyond me. Am buying another for myself just because it is an incredible deal. Go to Costco and buy a 3 year extended warranty with in house service for $29.99 and you have 4 years of coverage! Everyone thinks Plasma is yesterday. Don't be fooled. For $449.00 this TV is the equal to sets costing 2 to 3 times as much.

Reviews.Title: My mothers first reaction......(is that 50'?! WoW)
Reviews.Author: T. Cason "College Consumer"
Reviews.Content: This TV is boss.(Shipping)My TV came delivered from a company called Ceva. They are wonderful. I ordered my tv the Friday before labor day. Even though it was  Amazon 2 day shipping it was scheduled to be delivered on the Tuesday after labor day. I called up Ceva and they said they would be more than happy to deliver on Saturday instead of wait till after the holiday. And 3 hours later the delivery man was pulling up. (If you order the tv through Amazon it comes with a 'white glove' installation. Meaning the driver helps set it up) Trust me this tv is heavy so two people is a plus. The tv sat vertical on the truck and was nicely secured during transit.(Setup)The Tv comes with a base, swivel stand, a few screw and some other miscellaneous accessories. The base is a nice glossy black. The swivel stand is a hard plastic, not metal. The driver who was helping put it together was a bit reticent about that. But it seems sturdy. Everything was put together fine.(TV)In one word: Glorious. This is my first hd tv and it is made of awesome. As soon as we turned it on, got it setup with our cable my mom was blown away. The tv is very thin and the weight is evenly dispersed across the entire set. Not top heavy or bottom heavy. The picture quality is superb. - Sidenote: The remote is top notch, very good quality.- I know a lot of people say you should run tests on a plasma first in order to "break it in", but I saw no need to do this. Also the whole problem of leaving stagnant pictures on, white the tvis on, for long periods of time is sort of true. The screen saver for my set top box had a ghost image that stayed on for about 30 seconds after I changed the screen. (not a bid deal at all) Now, my windows are behind the tv and there are no windows in front of it; so reflection is not an issue at all. BTW if this is 720p I may faint if I see 1080p. lol. The image quality is spot on. Clear as day.This tv is perfection. Some call it "entry level", well if that is the case then this is at the top of the level. It is a great price at $548 and is worth every penny.09/12/12 ***************************************UPDATE*********************************************************Tv is still working fabulously. I do notice that even if you have a hint of light in the room that you can always see yourself in the tv. Its not so much annoying because you have to conscientiously look at your self to see it. (i dont know a better way to say it) But it is not a deal breaker.

Reviews.Title: Nice set for the price
Reviews.Author: D. Regan
Reviews.Content: Based on the price I should probably give this a 5/5 but nothing is perfect and this is a 720p set for 1080p (admittedly cheap LCD) money. Further, pretty much all Plasma 720p sets including this one aren't even true 720p. They are  1024x768 resolution, not 1280x720. This is due to the use of rectangular instead of square pixels. This does not mean they're hard on the eyes, in fact I'd rate this set significantly higher than the other sets in it's price range, LCD, LED (which is in fact LCD, just with an LED back-light instead of a compact florescent) or Plasma. The 1080p VIERA is nicer of course, but at double the price it had certainly better be.Given the assumption that pretty much all of your content is 720p or lower, which is currently true for anything except blu-ray, this is a great set and the up-scaling of standard definition content is significantly better than the Samsung models I compared it to. Color reproduction is excellent, there is no motion blur, blacks are black, off-angles are good, sound quality is both decent (far better than any of the slim sets) and offers an optical out for 5.1 surround. This feature is awesome for people like me with an great quality but older receiver that can't accept HDMI inputs, only composite, component and optical. I own two of these sets (one older model, one current) and I have not experienced any burn-in on either one. As I said, a good set for the price.

Reviews.Title: This is better than all the TV's on the Market
Reviews.Author: Charles Seiler
Reviews.Content: When it comes to audio and video, I would say I am entry level expert. I do video editing, build computers, process video formats, and use this TV as a computer monitor in addition to using it as a regular TV.My friend bought the same type of TV although he bought a Samsung 50 inch 720 P plasma. The Samsung will not run at its native resolution from a PC computer using HDMI cord. What this means is the Samsung picture does not look like it should when you're using a PC (lap top). However this TV does run at its native resolution of 1280 x 720, using an old Toshiba laptop, so this LG TV has the correct aspect ratio when you're watching movies from a small laptop using the RGB input. I have also tested this LG TV with an HDMI input and it also runs at 1280 x 720 directly from an HP lap top. You have to go to your monitor properties in Windows and uncheck the box that says "hide unsupported modes" and then you have to change the "adapter" settings in windows display settings, to 1280 x 720 @ 50hz, then you can use this TV as a monitor. It will look perfect this way when playing movies, as the aspect ratio (width/height) will be correct. Running any widescreen TV at 1024 x 768 will not yield the correct aspect ratio, and people will look short and fat, which is a huge problem if you actually want to get what you paid for.This is one of those rare electronic devices that has literally blown my mind with its features. At of all the things that I have purchased in my life, this TV has been the best value, it has the most features, and it is the most underrated of any device I have ever seen on the market.The single main negative: There is no bass to speak of from the speakers. However the speakers produce very natural sound, it is not a hollow sound, the voices are extremely clear and accurate, the treble is perfectly pitched and not too high, and the sound field appears to be coming from the center of the TV. On this LG TV the speakers are located on the bottom and the sound field sounds like it is coming from the center of the picture, it is truly amazing how they were able to make the sound so clean and so accurate. The only downside as I said is there is no bass but this is not really a downside considering the accuracy of the sound. Bear in mind a lot of Samsung TV's have speakers in the back. Try to avoid is rear facing speakers unless you don't plan on using the TV speakers. I don't have surround sound and don't want surround sound, this TV has very clean sound, and the voices are crisp and powerful. To me the voices are most important, along with the accuracy of the sound. This TV succeeds in both departments.Now to the most important part. You can plug a external hard drive into the side of this TV, and it will play any video. What it gives you is a menu that shows you all of the information on your hard drive. The menu is extremely user-friendly. This TV will play AVI files, H.264 (.mp4) files. It it will play MKV files and everything in between. However what is truly amazing is the way that it upscales the video. No matter what you throw at it, using the USB port on the side of the TV, whether it be a memory stick or an external hard drive, it makes the video look absolutely perfect.I have found some video files were the audio will not play. These are MKV files. All the AVI files have played perfectly thus far. I have tested about 70 videos, all of them played perfectly, some of the MKV files did not have audio though. Overall the video codecs are some of the best I've ever seen, the video codecs are responsible for decoding video when you are using the USB input on the side.The audio codecs are a little short on this TV however, only because some MKV files do not play audio. This is not much of a downside as MKV files are not common on the Internet for downloads. Most MKV files are 1.5 GB or larger. You can just download AVI files which are known as divx, this LG TV, will play all divx files that I have seen, and the audio is perfect. Chances are if you can find a file that is MKV, you can also find the same movie in AVI format. That's what I had to do for some movies.Now there is some debate whether you need a 1080 P TV, or a 720 P TV. You do not need a 1080 P TV, unless you are using a Blu-ray player. Personally I do not like Blu-ray discs due to their cost. I play all of my videos through the TVs USB port or from the RGB input on the back of the TV, from my laptop. If you use a 1080 P TV, the quality of downloaded movies, or old movies that are not Blu-ray, is actually reduced, because the TV has too many pixels, and the video must be scaled up to be much larger than it really is. A 720 P TV, actually has larger pixels, and less pixels, therefore there is less up-scaling needed when you are starting with a small, non-Blu-ray, video. What this means is 720 P makes most video look better, unless it is a Blu-ray. Most video is not Blu-ray, and if that's all you are watching, then you might benefit from a totally different TV.I am using a laptop with the RGB output, and this is plugged directly into the TV which also has an RGB input. RGB is a standard monitor cable from the old computers, before they went with HDMI, and DVI. This TV does not have a DVI input, however most computers have an RGB, or an HDMI output. Therefore you should be able to hook any computer to this TV. Beware that most TVs do not have an RGB input anymore. This was a tremendous benefit when researching this TV, and is one of the reasons I purchased it. If your laptop or computer does not have an HDMI, then you cannot hook it to most big-screen TVs, unless they have an RGB input, like this LG TV.The picture is outstanding with rich colors, and the viewing angle does not change no matter where you are in the room. The picture is just as bright up and down and side to side. You can see the picture from halfway across the room very clearly. The picture is extremely bright and I actually set it to a lower setting because it is so bright.This TV does make a hissing noise that is very faint due to it being a plasma TV. You can hear this hissing when there's no music or audio playing, when the TV is being used as a monitor or there is a silent scene in a movie, although I've never noticed it when watching a movie. My old Panasonic 42 inch plasma seemed quieter than this. I am very picky about my electronics, and the hissing is not an issue at all, since it is so faint.For the price I cannot believe that they even make a TV this good. The fact that it plays all "downloaded" movies with ease, except for a few MKV files that have no audio, and the level of picture quality, along with the user-friendliness of all the menus, and the very convenient button layout on the remote, I am somewhat shocked to be honest. My last Panasonic TV had none of these features, it cost $100 more, and it burned out within two years of barely using it, developing a large black stripe down the side.I am sold on LG TVs now and I would gladly purchase another. I have watched it almost nonstop for three weeks. I can assure you that I've tested it with more tests than any normal person would ever dare to do. The only thing I haven't done is play a Blu-ray disc from a Blu-ray player, but I have played Blu-ray files and they look outstanding.I would recommend this TV to anybody. I also think that the 50 inch size is perfect, there is a noticeable difference from a 42 inch, and it seems just right for most viewing. I plan on keeping this TV for as long as I can, until it kicks the bucket. I could never see a reason to replace it.

Reviews.Title: LG 42" Plasma, Pure Brilliance!
Reviews.Author: Kyle Stevenson "Dizzy"
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for the money. You can't honestly find anything better in it's price range that has all of it's features and quality. My first impression taking it out of the box was WOW! this is a really nicely built TV. It's very well constructed and feels high quality. It does not feel cheap like some LCD's in the same price range and has a very nice stand. Picture quality is just amazing! I compared it in a TV store next to a similar Samsung Plasma and a $600 Samsung 1080p LED LCD. My conclusion was that yes compared to the 1080p set of similar size you could tell a slight difference up close but once you stepped back past 6ft the Plasma starts to win out due to better color and depth. For an entry level TV I'd go with this over any of the 60hz LCD/LED sets. I'd even take it over a 1080p 120hz LCD/LED. Once you get the settings all the way you like them this has serious bang for your buck.My only complaints are:1- The speakers are not brilliant... This is a not an issue though because most people use a sound system. The speakers are not too bad though.2- The advanced menu can be a little confusing seeing as how the manual is not very good at explaining things.3- Screen glare is an issue. But to be honest it's better than the CRT I came from. It's not really noticeable unless you have a window behind your TV like i do.Overall, for the cost of this unit, I'd say 5 stars well earned. I think it's worth more than I payed for it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Al I.
Reviews.Content: I helped our neighbors pick out this TV from Amazon.com, as they thought they needed to replace a broken TV. Turns out they were able to fix the broken TV, so they were going to send this one back. Instead, I bought it from them at cost and now it's mine, all mine. This TV has a fantastic picture, and was very easy to set up. There is a small bit of assembly to attach the base to the bottom of the screen. Other plasma TVs around this size (we bought the 50" one) seem to be more expensive and I don't understand what might be different. The bezel around the screen is very small, meaning the cabinet is almost entirely screen, no big wide edge of plastic around the screen. And the TV is very thin.

Reviews.Title: Great Bargin
Reviews.Author: William Morris
Reviews.Content: I purchased this over a month ago for $500 and at that price it is definitely a steal. I did my research and Plasma was the choice for me since the TV is mounted in a dark room and I did not need an overly bright LED. I love the low profile trim and it's thickness, it looks great mounted above the fireplace.If you are looking for an excellent television with a minimal price tag this is your deal.

Reviews.Title: A GREAT TV sent by mistake!
Reviews.Author: keng
Reviews.Content: I ordered the LG 42LK450 (LCD) and got sent the LG 42PA4500 (plasma) by mistake.Well I was a bit upset at first since I had to unpack the TV (it was double boxed) to find outthat it was the wrong one.  I thought I'ld check it out since it was already unpacked, and I was really surprised.So much so that I decided to keep it! The plasma TV was 720p and I was a bit skeptical but the pictureis amazing! Sound is GREAT and the TV is real easy to set up, and easy to use and adjust to your needs.Meanwhile, the 3rd party supplier offered to exchange it for the one that I originally ordered, but afterusing it for a few days, I declined saying that I was happy with the 'mistake'.  Cost of the two differentTV's were about the same, so everyone ended up happy!  Very pleased with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Second LG television that stopped working within a year
Reviews.Author: LynnB
Reviews.Content: After nine months, this television stopped working.  When powering on it immediately powers off.  We purchased through Warehouse Deals on Amazon.  That was a bad decision considering it nullified the warranty.  I highly discourage buying any electronics through Warehouse Deals unless you purchase the extended warranty.  We also purchased a 60" LG plasma television that we returned because it did the same as this television.  We returned it and purchased another.  Unfortunately, it also was not working.  We gave up and went to Best Buy.

Reviews.Title: 50 plasma
Reviews.Author: dmj
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this tv, although i feel the pic on our 32" in better. We have a very small living room so a 50 " might have been a bit much. Overall I like the tv and would reccommend.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money
Reviews.Author: Matthew S. Smith "m smith"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this set to replace a 40inch Samsung LCD suffering the capacitor problem. I was not budgeting for a TV so I decided to go cheap.Picture quality is excellent. The lower resolution is visible at times' such as when I am browsing my Roku. It is never noticeable in movies unless you sit closer than 5 feet, which is to close anyway.Colors are beautiful and blacks are deep. The difference between this and my older LCD is significant. If you want a lovely picture for a low price it seems plasma is the way to go.Standard definition content is also better than most sets, probably due to the lower resolution. Old content does not need to be stretched as much to fit the screen.The screen is reflective. This makes the display a bit less beautiful in daylight. I do not recommend this TV if you would be placing it in an area that recieves direct sunlight.Connectivity is also limited.Overall this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Dennis Lane
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this LG plasma TV.  It is my first plasma TV and the colors and picture are just fabulous.  You cannot find a better TV for the money that you pay for this product!

Reviews.Title: Good value for $400 (and free shipping)
Reviews.Author: Alex Marshall
Reviews.Content: Great picture and OK sound. Controls are clear and easy to understand. Not a smart TV, but what do you want for $400? I've added Apple TV, which gives me all the internet I need for a total of less than $500. Main quibble is that there are only two HDMI ports, so DVD connection will have to be component. Oh, well.

Reviews.Title: My BIG TV
Reviews.Author: Janas Kukla "ljkukla"
Reviews.Content: I never thought a thing about getting a big television set but, my 'tube tv' started to fade on me so I was in the market for a new one when I was looking at Amazon for my daily deals and found this jewel!! I just love it. This monster was too big for me to handle and I was worried about it after I sent my money and knew it was being delivered int he mail....but good 'ole Amazon thought of everything....they had a couple of fellows come with the tv and helped me move the old one to the next room and placed my new one in its place. I just love it. I can see the guide now, I can see my shows so much better, nice television and even better customer service, thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Plasma TV
Reviews.Author: C. Star "C R E"
Reviews.Content: I've owned this TV for one month.  Previously I had a 37" LED.  For the price, I am overwhelmed at how awesome the picture is.  I read a lot of reviews between this tv and several others in the price range for 50".  Before, and since buying it, I walk around the displays at Best Buy and without looking at prices just try to see what tv's have a better picture than my own.  I am shocked at times to see a tv twice look worse (this could be the way they have it set up in the store.)  The price range you start to see a difference is about $1,500+.That being said, I think the picture on this tv is beautiful.  The blacks are black and the colors really pop.  Some have complained of the reflective glare and if you have windows in front of the tv it will reflect during the day like any plasma.  My windows are behind the tv so I don't have this problem.I used the picture wizard to set up the display settings after using some of the settings over users provided.  The wizard is very helpful.This is not a "smart" tv in that it is not hooked up to the internet and can't stream netflicks.  I use a desktop computer and hook that up to one of the HDMI inputs.  It is a very simple solution to having a smart TV.  I have a wireless keyboard and mouse and play video games, download movies, etc all through my desktop to the TV.I still can't believe I only paid $500 for it.  One downside is that it could probably have another HDMI input.  I don't use DVD's (play through the desktop) and game systems and this could be a downside to someone who needs a lot of HDMI inputs.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, not perfect.
Reviews.Author: R. Brociek "New Amazonphile"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for the bedroom and was very happy to get rid of the 36" TriniTON.  This is a great replacement.  Won't go into any details on the specs but will simply jump right into my one gripe.  Usually, when turning on the TV, there are visible red pixels throughout the screen regardless of the source.  This usually only lasts for a few seconds then it's not a problem until the next time I turn it on.  Very minor issue, that I've not spent any time worrying about since it's such a short lived event, but wanted to make any other potential buyers aware of my experience.  Would definitely buy again despite this minor gripe.

Reviews.Title: great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Tony Velez
Reviews.Content: great tv for the price, delivery guys are great, tv was in upright position in truck ( laying plasma tv flat on floor is not recommended ) no problems so far !!

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Really enjoying this plasma. The picture is fantastic from where I sit about 12 feet away. I generally use it for FIOS or gaming and 720p is what is broadcasted, so I'm not missing anything by not having a 1080p set.The set is also pretty slim and fairly easy to move around.If you have trouble spending a lot of money on technology that becomes yesterday's news so quickly, this TV proves you don't have to to get some quality kit.

Reviews.Title: Plasma for under $550
Reviews.Author: b steve clay
Reviews.Content: Perfect for small rooms and apartments.  I've lived with it for about 2 weeks now and I could not be happier considering the price/performance ratio.  Easy to set up, all the functionality I need, picture is more than adequate and fully customizable to suit the indivdual user.  For the price you can't go wrong.  Volume is enough to bother the neighbors if you're not careful.  It is heavy, so if you're going to set it up yourself, have an extra set of hands available to lift and place it--

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture
Reviews.Author: D. Gardner
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with my purchase. I've had people tell me not to purchase 720p TV's because the quality is bad but I gave it a shot anyway. This TV has a great picture and is a steal for the price I paid. I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for something nice and on a budget!

Reviews.Title: Crisp, amazing price.
Reviews.Author: huck finn
Reviews.Content: 50" for $500?  No brainer.  Get this TV, adequate peripherals, and the TV is slimmer then I thought it'd be.  Great buy.

Reviews.Title: Affordable, Quality, HDTV from LG
Reviews.Author: C Ray "ttruthseeker"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 4500 model in April 2012 after much research for the best budget HDTV (aka bang for my buck)!  I have not been disappointed with my purchase.  This TV seems huge to me.  The screen is very large & I love the high picture quality.  The remote is great because you can change between widescreen & other sizes based on what you are watching, easily adjust the color, etc., & the sound.  If there is one caveat, I would say it is the sound which is not primo.  I adjusted mine quite a bit to get the sound I prefer & from the remote I am often changing the sound based on the show.  I've found the "music" setting actually boosts the sound, particularly on British shows or old black & white movies making it easier to hear & understand.  I never added a sound bar or anything.  I just  use the TV with a satellite service & with ROKU.  It interfaced very very easily with Roku.  I've never had any problems at all with the TV even after power outages.  In the late evening sun I close my blinds to prevent any glare but any other time it is fine.  Keep in mind this unit is quite heavy, 72 pounds, & you will need help moving it around & setting it up.  Even if you can LIFT 72 pounds, the size is a bit awkward for one person.  It is easy to dust & it can be moved on the swivel if you prefer to change it for any reason at all.  Highly recommend.  The price is about $40 less than I paid with prime & free shipping over a year ago.  Good, solid tv, at a reasonable price. Great for watching movies, particularly stunning when I watched HUGO.  Cheers!

Reviews.Title: Well worth the price
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Bought if for our bedroom to replace an older Sony TV.  Although just 720p, plasmas color and refresh make it an ideal choice especially at around $500.  As with all plasmas, reflection is an issue but as we ave north facing bedroom indirect lighting doesn't impact quality too much but could see impact if more light came in.  Have some reflections from bedrooms lighting at evening, but either got used to it quickly or else never was a major issue.  Doesn't have all of the latest features, but for price wouldn't expect it to.Have the latest Sony LED 55 inc downstairs and this picture compares favorably for like 1/5 te priceSolid built frame and stand, Sleek look when turned off.  Highly recommend if budget tight or looking for an extra TV

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Jabson
Reviews.Content: I took this TV, due to i wanted to have a bigger TV, LG is excellent and its works very well. Thanks a lot.

Reviews.Title: Realy Great
Reviews.Author: Hallam W. Gibson "Starvin Marvin"
Reviews.Content: The family loooovvvee this tv! Picture is great and the tv itself looks great!  Gonna purchase another similar to this for my bedroom!

Reviews.Title: lg plazma tv
Reviews.Author: Charles DeHaan.
Reviews.Content: very happy with this tv .everything I wanted .best bang for the buck. I would highly recomend this tv to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: Plasma is hard to beat
Reviews.Author: S. Wilson
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the price and picture brings the football game into the room. Bought this for a gift for my brother and he is ecstatic.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV
Reviews.Author: Sparky
Reviews.Content: The TV came quickly and was packaged well.  Very easy to program and user friendly.  It looks great on the wall and has done a great job.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Leibel
Reviews.Content: Im very happy with this tv!Highly recommended!Sound is so amazing and the picture is even better!It's very quite and thin for a plasma but weights a lot.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for the money
Reviews.Author: Tim Kane
Reviews.Content: awesome tv for the money. picture looks great. I would recommend this to anyone looking for an affordable  plasma screen

Reviews.Title: Great picture and price for plasma
Reviews.Author: M. Vandusen "Vandy838"
Reviews.Content: I have noticed some of the aspects that shy people away from plasma such as glare and at times seeing outline of images after they have left the screen.However, picture quality is great and the hang ups with plasma would not stop me from buying again. The price cant be beat.The picture is significantly better than my older 1080p LCD.

Reviews.Title: LG Plasma 42
Reviews.Author: David C. Smith
Reviews.Content: Great plasma TV for the money.  Had a Sony 27 inch console Tritron since 1988 and was waiting for it to burn out, but it never would.  Took the plunge anyway.  The LG plasma picture is great, vivid and sharp.  Easy set-up.  Amazon also sells in indoor Leaf amplified antenna which way out performs my old rooftop providing about 14 channels instead of 4 from towers 40 miles away.  Was able to ditch Dish and with a savings of about $50 a month, will pay for the new TV in about 10 months.  Delivery was great, although as a courtesy, they took the box and I wish I had been a little faster and kept it in case I have to move it sometime.  Good buy.

Reviews.Title: 50 inch lg
Reviews.Author: becca
Reviews.Content: Love this t.v! Awesome picture, great sound, very easy to assemble can't best the price!I recommend anyone interested in a new t.v , to buy this one!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a great price!
Reviews.Author: S. Scott "srs"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv for $499 w/ free shipping.  I really don't think you can beat that right now, unless you get a deal on black friday.  I never really cared if a tv was 720p or 1080p... for me this 50 inch 720p is just fine and looks great, especially for the price.  The only thing that I was a little weary of was the shipping company amazon used to ship my tv, which was CEVA. I have never heard of them, and I actually called them because I guess I needed to set up a time for delivery and they weren't the people who actually delivered my TV to my house... they said that they bring it to a local trucking company, which was named Thrift trucking and that I had to call them and set up a time to deliver with them.  Once I called the Thrift trucking to set the delivery time up, the lady was kind of rude at first and not very helpful. I ended up calling back and just asking if I could come pick the TV up myself from them and I was able to just do that.  Other than that it was all in all a great deal and would def recommend this TV at the low price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture and price
Reviews.Author: John Burkhalter
Reviews.Content: The LG 42" Plasma TV has an excellent picture which began at the first power-on. The delivery was within the scheduled window (by 5 minutes); the set-up was only for unpacking, set-up, and power-on via remote, but it was done very efficiently and politely.

Reviews.Title: Wow....
Reviews.Author: Envy
Reviews.Content: Outstanding tv going to buy 2 more this tv is 720 not 1080 but looks just as good no difference

Reviews.Title: 50" LG was best in showroom and at home
Reviews.Author: Good Man named Mike
Reviews.Content: Saw this in the showroom at one of the "big box" retailers was able to use a coupon and get the whole thing for 455.00  This 50" turned out to be considerably better than my 50" Panasonic Veira 720p and now I'm giving that away.  Everyone complains about the glare of the LG in the reviews, but the same glare is what consistently makes this better looking than every plasma tv I saw in the store.  It gives the picture a high gloss versus a matte finish.  The only problem is when it goes to black and you have lights on, you can see your reflection in the screen.  I think you may can get used to it, but its more than made up by the brilliant colors.  I mean simply amazing colors and I measured and it seems to be a 51 and 1/2 inch screen.  I will remeasure again but its a bit bigger than 50.  My old 50" Panasonic Veira Plasma used 475w and you could feel the heat emanating from it, this one only uses 175w...a full 64% less energy bill.  I love it!!!Another great feature though is the usb.  You can upload pictures, music or video.  I tried mp4, divx, wmv, and even flv and it played all of them seamlessly.  It actually plays the bigger files better than my pc does which was shocking.  It has some kind of built in player that lets you fast forward 2x, 4x, and 6x speeds.  Hey, what can I say?  This thing is perfect so far.  Oh and it swivels.  Nice touch!!

Reviews.Title: good picture, so-so sound
Reviews.Author: William A. van Veen
Reviews.Content: Solid picture quality, but the sound is not as crisp and clear as on the Sony I have in my living room. Highs tend to be a bit more muted, and even though there is a mode to boost the mid range "talk" frequencies, it doesn't seem to help all that much.

Reviews.Title: Nice!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Lawman176
Reviews.Content: Very good picture quality despite being only a 720p.....sound is very good and set up was really easy and required minimum tools.  Excellent deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: SWEET TV - picture is great!
Reviews.Author: Joe K.
Reviews.Content: I had a comparable Samsung model just before I had this one. I loved the Samsung so much. The picture was great and everything worked perfectly. That TV broke (something fell into it) and instead of getting the same one, I got this LG instead. It was a good deal on amazon at the time of purchase and I wanted to try it out. I'm glad I did because this one was better. Clearer picture, more vibrant, great preset settings. Would definitely recommend it for the price!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV.
Reviews.Author: Roughrider
Reviews.Content: Great picture. Easy installation and compatible with our system. We plan to buy a second for our house.TV has the VESA mounting interface standard and is compatible with most TV mounts having the standard (we bought our mount for $20).Recommended.

Reviews.Title: love,love,love it
Reviews.Author: unie
Reviews.Content: what a beautiful picture. i just love it. was a little worried when not only the outside box had a big hole in it but the inside box that the tv was it also had a large hole it it but it was well padded thank god. works great and has a super picture.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Dawn
Reviews.Content: I ordered my tv 1 year ago and I love it! It's not compatible with netflix or anything internet related but it's truly a great television.

Reviews.Title: Excellent T.V.
Reviews.Author: NGM
Reviews.Content: Going from a tube T.V. to this is heaven. As usual Amazon's delivery and set up of the T.V. was superb. The picture and sound are excellent.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Alphonso
Reviews.Content: GREAT BUY AND GREAT PRICE AND VERY SMART TV ALL ROLLED UP INTO ONE. I GLAD I PUCHASE THIS IDEM...

Reviews.Title: SATISFACTION
Reviews.Author: Helen Britton
Reviews.Content: i AM VERY HAPPY WITH MY lG42PA4500 THE HDTV REALLY MAKES A DIFFERENCE OVER MY OLD TV.  i WISH I HAD PURCHASED IT SOONER.

Reviews.Title: great price
Reviews.Author: Harold Wakelam
Reviews.Content: only complaint, being old and decrepit the  sound out put (optical) caused me to buy a optical to analog conveter. Easy once you know about these things

Reviews.Title: USB won't work
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: Bought this from Costco for a great price.The USB works for some files, but when I connect my new 3T WD external drive, it won't accept it.Is anyone else having this problem?Customer service says that I can't upgrade the firmware to fix this issue.

Reviews.Title: Good downstairs TV
Reviews.Author: D. Whitley
Reviews.Content: Hooked up easy, great colors and blacks.  No problems since I bought it!  Would recommend to my friends as well.

Reviews.Title: Very nice for the money
Reviews.Author: Veronica Thorn
Reviews.Content: This TV is great value for the money... I did not purchase from Amazon but a retail store that had a special of $449.  Love the picture quality and the ease of use.  Good value

Reviews.Title: Better than expected...
Reviews.Author: R. Villarreal
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv a few weeks ago and still in like it very much. Its been a truly positive experience on my first flat screen.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: James Mattis "nismozx"
Reviews.Content: Good value for the money if you are NOT playing Blue Ray. Then you will need 1080. Easy to set up. I did almost send it back because I did not have a H.D. signal. but after I got my H.D. reciever the picture is great. NO H.D. then this TV {or maby any H.D. TV} is not for you. NO electronics expert just a regular guy..but I do like this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: We purchased an LG42PA4500, plasma television and it has been a pleasant surprise.  We purchased it because Consumer Reports had recommended it as a best buy if purchase for less than $500.00.  We got it for $399.00 with free shipping and were able to schedule the date and time of delivery for our convenience.  It arrived on time, was easy to set up and works very well as a second TV in my wife's bedroom.  Couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Great TV For The Price
Reviews.Author: prescottsweet
Reviews.Content: The 42" was the largest my cabinet would hold.  Cannot give you any great technical review terms here, but the LG has a great, clear picture and is better overall than the smaller Sanyo that it replaced.

Reviews.Title: 50" LG plasma tv meets with my approval!!!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Thomas
Reviews.Content: I needed to update from my 60" big screen projection tv so I chose this LG 50" Plasma HDTV.  I find it is just as wide as my big screen ...although not as deep but it updates the look of my living room and takes up a whole lot less space.  It was easy to set up and with just my son to help me lift it up onto the table I was ready to go.  It was easy to set up and the picture was great.  So far...no complaints and I'm very happy with my purchase.  The price was reasonable as well.

Reviews.Title: Really enjoying this television
Reviews.Author: Janice R. Bradford
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for about a month now and I am enjoying it.  Some people would say don't get a plasma TV but for me, the picture is just as good or better than the LCD TVs in my house.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Great Price
Reviews.Author: ABS89
Reviews.Content: Television was shipped and delivered to me expeditiously. The picture is clear and colors are vibrant. I do not notice the lower pixilation from a distance of 5-10 feet, but it is noticeable up-close. Overall, a great television at an excellent price point.

Reviews.Title: 720p as expected
Reviews.Author: Heather Langille
Reviews.Content: It's not great for sports unlike my other plasma. But it still does it's job. It can sometimes be a little pixelated (not sure if that would be the right word). If sitting at a sharp angle, the TV isn't too great. Otherwise it works well and it serves its purpose.It's also a lot darker than other TVs. With the brightness all the way up, I still notice that the picture quality is darker than the other TVs in the house.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!!
Reviews.Author: B. Bossard
Reviews.Content: I was a little scepticle about buying a TV on line, but, for the price I decided to try it.  Turned out to be a GOOD decision.  Everyone who walks into the living room comments on what a clear picture it has, so don't let the 720p scare you away. The picture quality is excellent & we love the size.  The TV arrived very quickly & on a truck that delivers mostly TV's.  The driver was carefull and friendly.  No problems at all getting it up and running.  I would recommend this to anyone looking for a good deal on a GREAT TV!!!

Reviews.Title: Great set--maybe not for the Amateur Radio Operator
Reviews.Author: J. Fred Riley "preferred customer"
Reviews.Content: Nice packing.  Quick delivery--and on time.  Plugged it in.  It worked.  Sister is now happy.  And with the wonderful flesh tones it delivers, it's a great buy at the price. Amateur operators should, however, note that it is a noise generator of noise that I can't suppress.  Even with total isolation on the power and antenna input cable and thoroughly RF grounded, this set emits enough noise to kill most HF bands.  My 43" has noise on 10M but this one kills all the HF bands.

Reviews.Title: AMAZing Plasma TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Norm
Reviews.Content: The 42" LG Plasma HDTV is the greatest birthday gift for my 90 year old mother.  She loves it!  What an improvement over her 25" analog tv.  The order was placed online with Amazon and delivered by TigerDirectInc.Great shopping experience, was delivered on time to my mother's apartment.  The set up was easy.  All her family and friends all agree, this was the right choice for Mom!  The clarity of picture and sound is perfect, and easy to use.  Thanks again to LG, a great product!

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: The Big IP
Reviews.Content: This is my first big screen as I have been waiting for the prices to come down before spending too much on a TV.  I am very happy with the picture and the easy navigation between inputs.  For the price I highly recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: Review of LG 42-Inch 720p 600 Hz Plasma HDTV
Reviews.Author: LR53
Reviews.Content: Good picture with plenty of input and output jacks for my DVD, VCR, and additional devices.  A good TV at a good price.  I'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Just stops working on 6th month after purchasing.
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: On 6th month after I purchased this TV it just shuts down on the middle of an action movie from a flash driver.All our attempts to turn it on again fail. It just turns off immediately after you push the button on TV or on remote.No answer from technical support.

Reviews.Title: Good enough
Reviews.Author: lefthandsam
Reviews.Content: Using this unit outside in a bar. TV is very bright and good enough for this use. Better quality than some of our other tv's for a good price.

Reviews.Title: anti motion blur
Reviews.Author: dsan
Reviews.Content: look here ..only reason I went with a flat screen is because my old sony trintron blew up and what an adventure ..wanted a lg to match my lg sound system got a 47 truemotion led and it was so bad took it back got a 32 led and it was ok but gave it to mom the motion blur bothered me...I got a farely dark house so decided to try a plazma ...omy gosh this blew me away the color and the picture so much better and guess what ...no motion blur to bother me .sound isnt bad ethier but sound system alwasy help good luck yall I LIKE IT. five stars for me

Reviews.Title: Love the TV, not happy with Amazon's delivery
Reviews.Author: M. Campbell
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my mom's birthday when it went on sale. She's really liked it so far, see the TV review below. However, it was my first time ordering a TV through Amazon, and I was a little hesitant since it was slightly cheaper at a local store. Amazon's "enhanced" delivery is what swayed me, and I was disappointed.Amazon's Promise: Free scheduled delivery, unpacking, operational test, removal of packaging if desired. Estimated delivery on a Thursday.Reality: Thursday came and went, no TV. Amazon tracking showed that it had arrived at the destination city at noon on Wednesday, and nothing further. I assumed the carrier had received it and would call, that didn't happen either. I had to look up the carrier's website online and plug in their tracking number to see that they had the TV and were scheduling delivery for Wednesday the following week. We called them and got a Monday delivery. At this point I was irritated that the estimated date of delivery was wrong, Amazon gave me no insight to tracking once it went to the carrier, and that the carrier never called. I sent an email to customer service, with a promise of an answer in 12 hours - no reply. Monday comes and the TV is dropped off by the carrier. No unpacking, no removal of packaging, no power-on test. When questioned, the delivery guy claimed he knew nothing about any of that and just did delivery. Now I am irritated enough to contact customer service again, by live chat this time.Typically, Amazon's customer service is really good. I was surprised that this time I didn't get much help. First I asked if they had seen my previous email - no, somehow this was lost (despite my confirmation message). Next I relayed my problems, they apologized and said they'd investigate with the carrier, is there anything else? That was it. I said I'd appreciate a note in my account authorizing return shipping for any damage (since it wasn't unpacked and checked), and a small amount of credit if the investigation did find the carrier at fault. The rep wouldn't confirm anything but simply said she'd pass it along to her manager. I would have much preferred she put me on hold and did that immediately, or at least promised to follow-up with an email in a certain time period. It's been about two weeks and I haven't heard anything.I was unimpressed with Amazon's TV delivery service and probably won't use it again.TV ReviewPros:-Very thin design, this is thinner than most LCDs and almost as slim as an LED TV.-Great picture-Very good sound. Her old Philips was very bad, this one is loud and has Clear Voice to boost dialogue, which does make a difference.-Nice menu system, attractive and not overly complicated-Swivels on standCons:-Only two HDMIs-Fingerprint magnet, needs to be cleaned every time you touch it to adjust

Reviews.Title: Fry's electronics sells this model for $299-320 it's an awesome deal
Reviews.Author: RV
Reviews.Content: Fry's electronics put this on sale for $299 early and late July 2012. They were selling it online for $320, but they do not specify this in the newspaper ads and you can only see the price online after you add it to your cart.  They list a "Major name brand 42" plasma for $299" in the newspaper ad. I bought one on July 29, 2012 and was thrilled when I found out it was this LG model and not some cheapo brand.  I am very impressed with everything about the tv except it only has 2 hdmi connections.  Its easily worth $4-$500 but if you can get the Fry's deal this is an exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy if you need an HDMI connection.
Reviews.Author: Patricia M. McElhaney
Reviews.Content: It's a fine TV if you don't need to use the HDMI connection.  Unfortunately, being a TIVO user, that's all I use.  Several times a day the video goes black.  Sometimes turning the TV off and then on brings the video back.  Other times, I have to unplug the HDMI cord and plug it back into the TV.  I wish someone had posted this before I bought this TV...

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: joe_c329
Reviews.Content: I purchased an LG 50" 720p plasma two years ago for a great price and have been 100% satisfied. LG makes great tvs and the picture quality for being a 720p is outstanding. Several people were shocked that the picture was better than their 1080p lcds.

Reviews.Title: Excellent brand, good TV
Reviews.Author: Septimus
Reviews.Content: Every LG product I've owned has been good to me so far, with the exception of a certain AT&T; phone which I won't mention. I've owned an LG LCD monitor for the past 3-4 years, and it hasn't failed on me yet. With this in mind, I decided to go with LG for my first HDTV purchase. It arrived on time, albeit the delivery guy was about half an hour early on the estimated time (which I'm not complaining about, but was a tad unprofessional) and very thankfully was not broken. It was a relief considering the delivery guy told me a short story about his last TV delivery involving a huge crack down the middle of the display. At any rate, I installed the TV in my room myself with minor difficulty (the display itself is light enough for one person to lift so long as they're careful and have a good grip.) I plugged it in, turned it on, fiddled with the display settings a bit (not much is needed here, as there's a smart sensor on the TV that will adjust the picture and brightness to match the rooms brightness), and in no time I was enjoying my new HDTV. My one complaint about this TV and the reason it's not getting the full five stars is that it ceased to work for me after a few weeks of use. After contacting the LG warranty service (got put on hold for ten minutes and got hung up on the first time) and getting my claim number, I had to wait another week for the repair shop to contact me. After a week and a half with no response, I called their number and found they knew nothing of my scheduled repair, which was a big shocker (sarcasm.) Upon finally getting service, they determined the unit had a faulty control panel. After another three days, I had my TV back and working like new. Other than the annoying warranty service (which was actually quite fast compared to other services) and the faulty unit, I really enjoy this TV and plan on moving out with it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent 720p Plasma
Reviews.Author: wig
Reviews.Content: Excellent 720p Plasma for the money! Picture is bright and sharp and sound is great. For 500 shipped its a steal.

Reviews.Title: Horrible TV even for a budget model
Reviews.Author: eagle1
Reviews.Content: If you get most of your TV from over the air (antenna) then run don't walk away from this piece of junk.  Nearly unwatchable on Stand Def. 480i material, even 720p and 1080i programing is not very good, picture is soft and during camera panning picture breaks up almost like LCD motion blur.  Background scenes sometimes appear to be shimmering and pixelated.  To be fair DVD and Netflix look OK through a PS3 using HDMI cable however the bad outweighs the good on this TV.  This is by far the worst TV I have owned and possibly ever made.  You can probably do better with Samsungs 720p plasma, however the cheap panasonic was just as bad as this LG.  Perhaps manufacturers are just not putting quality video processors into their inexpensive plasmas.  Save you money look elswhere!

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Deniese A. Hinds-Esquivel "voracious reader"
Reviews.Content: This TV had great ratings on Amazon so I purchased it.  I had to return it. The picture quality was terrible.  Looked hazy and unfocused.

Reviews.Title: Recieved it and it has a 12 inch black strip down the middle of the screen
Reviews.Author: Duane
Reviews.Content: I recieved my new tv as promised on Friday.  Unpacked it and plugged it in and I have a 12 inch black stripe down the middle of the screen.  Called LG and they said they would send somebody out to fix my tv on Tuesday.  They gave me a phone umber and an RNM number but suggested I called Electra Sound Inc. on Monday to confirm appointment.  I just call Electra Sound Inc and they have no idea what I am talking about.  Now I get to wait til Friday for them to order my part and come fix this tv.  If I had it to do over again, I would not get an LG as they ship defective tv's and give you the runaround.  I would suggest also to buy it local so you can just take it back without all this bull crap.

Reviews.Title: Electronics Expo SUCKS!!!
Reviews.Author: Diggla
Reviews.Content: This item worked for all of 4 days and the picture went out. I've had the tech come out to my home twice already and he said the same thing both times"They sold you a defective tv."

Reviews.Title: Take the time to Inspect
Reviews.Author: K. Higgins "Blake"
Reviews.Content: Bought this LG 50" TV at a great price for my new home.  Had to wait to install it since my move in got delayed a few weeks.  Had a professional installation company come out to hang it for me when we noticed a big problem.  The screen was cracked.  Wow, what a shocker after spending $150 for the installation.  I quickly went to the Amazon site to see about a return/replacement, but NO, past the 30 day window for a return/replacement according to their site (TV arrived on 7/8, I installed on 8/28).  I called, and got the same message, no exceptions.  So, this post is to tell EVERYONE out there, OPEN THE BOX when the delivery guy shows up. The box had no visible damage so you would assume it would be fine. The box was very narrow and it can fall over pretty easy, so assume it got dropped a few times on the way to my home, so now I know. I know it is a pain to open it up and inspect, but do it, and do it while the delivery company is there. This lesson cost me $700, don't let it happen to you.

Reviews.Title: LG playde dead after pacing Order
Reviews.Author: Nadal
Reviews.Content: I ordered 50 inch Plazma on 20.March 2013 here (Amazon/LG) for USD 499.00 and received automated order acknowledgment. 4 days later still no update on the status so I contacted Amazon - product is still at the distributor and delivery -  god knows when.... Cancelled order and buying locally- interestingly after cancellation the 50 inch plasma is no longer available for $499, but it now rings $623. The 42 inch is availbale for $499 and I'm confident that the cancellation was just what LG was waiting for, because evidently the $499 for 50 inch was a price error. LG decided to stay put and wait it up - evidently it paid off, whether I will now buy a TV from LG aka "Life is Good" - I seriously doubt. This incident also spolied my thus far excellent Amazon experience....

Reviews.Title: Wanted to love ....
Reviews.Author: JessicaAy
Reviews.Content: Received this tv, and the screen was crushed. The company sent out a new one ASAP. Received it a week later (left on my front porch) with no signature required. Not sure if this is a company issue or ups, either way, why would you leave a clearly marked large purchase on a porch. Took it inside aaaaand it wouldn't turn on. Lg sent someone to replace parts. Three weeks later .... Three little red dots appear on the screen. Waiting for lg to send someone out again!!!! Frustrated .... I hope after all this I looooove this tv.
